title.narrative: Nutrition Emergency Pool in the DRC (PUNC II)

description.narrative: ACF has been working in the DRC with other partners since 1997, but between 2000 and 2010, the nutritional status of the country took a turn for the worst. Multiple surveys were conducted and the Nutritional Emergency Pool was created in 2007 to help ACF-USA implement a programme of reinforcement of the PRONANUT in order to consolidate the institutional capacities for the treatment of acute malnutrition and surveillance at the national, provincial and local levels. This integrative approach is comprised of three main components: the identification of nutrition crisis and the emergency response, which were already, found in the previous PUNC project, as well as support to the communities’ resilience.
